instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 2016 Retina
threads.message:
The only component that looks to be damaged. Are there any boardviews or schematics out for this yet? could someone tell me what it is please


Nothing happens when plugged in or when holding down powerbutton

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 2016 Retina
threads.message: Yeah that's a FET in the CPU power supply. I guess you kniw what that probably means.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 2016 Retina
threads.message: Most likely a dead cpu? Died at such a young age

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 2016 Retina
threads.message: Is the lid assembly compatible with touchbar models?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 2016 Retina
threads.message:
I have no idea.
I would pull that FET and do some measurements. FET and the regulator driving it need to be replaced for sure
